repository.corpname: Digital Collections and Archives, Tufts University

did.abstract: This collection contains materials created by or associated with the University Chaplaincy, documenting programming and events, the work of specific chaplains and chaplaincies, the history of Goddard Chapel, the history of religion at Tufts, and the Chaplaincy's outreach efforts.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This collection may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the University Chaplaincy, 2018, accession UA-2019-002; 2020, accession UA-2021-019; 2021, accessions UA-2021-034 and UA-2022-029.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of five series: Web crawls; 2018 accessions; Unprocessed accessions; Born digital materials; and 2020 -- 2021 accessions.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Edwin Courtlandt Bolles was made the first chaplain of the university in 1905. Today, the Tufts Chaplaincy is committed to modeling interreligious harmony and well-being at Tufts. Each chaplain serves those who are in his, her, or their tradition through regular worship and other programs. Valuing pluralism and multiculturalism, it educates tomorrow's leaders for global citizenship by actively encouraging dialogue and cooperation among the wide variety of religious traditions on the campuses.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: University Chaplaincy Records, 1865 -- 2021. Tufts University. Digital Collections and Archives. Medford, MA

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection is partially processed. 2018 accessions and born digital materials were processed by Leah Edelman and Margaret Peachy in 2018-2019. Physical materials were placed in archival boxes if the original housing was damaged, and loose materials were placed in folders where needed; received order was maintained. Born digitial materials were stabilizied and bagged using Bagger; open materials were uploaded to and made available via Box, and closed materials were ingested to the Dark Archive. File-level inventories and series-level descriptions were created, and the finding aid was updated at the time of processing. Web sites were crawled by Archive-It and web crawl information is updated in the finding aid annually.

The 2020 and 2021 accessions were processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Jane Kelly in 2021. Materials were bagged using Bagger and ingested to the Tufts Digital Library. Received order was maintained. A file-level inventory was created, and series and collection-level description were updated at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains materials created by or associated with the University Chaplaincy. Materials include correspondence, publications, fliers, newsletters, photographs and slides, hymnals and song books, VHS and cassette tapes, born digital audio, video, and photographic materials, as well as web crawls of the Tufts University Chaplaincy website. The collection documents Chaplaincy programming and events and Chaplaincy participation in University events, the work of specific chaplains and chaplaincies, the history of Goddard Chapel, the history of religion at Tufts, and the Chaplaincy's outreach efforts.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Some material in this collection may be protected by copyright and other rights. Please see "Reproductions and Use" on the Digital Collections and Archives website for more information about reproductions and permission to publish. Copyright to all materials created by Tufts University employees in the course of their work is held by the Trustees of Tufts University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Quarterly web crawls of the Tufts University Chaplaincy website crawled by DCA, as part of the Student Organizations web collection, to document the presesence of Tufts University student organizations on the web.

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids
otherfindaid.p: To see all of websites crawled as part of the Student Organizations web collection, please visit https://archive-it.org/collections/6387

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged roughly by format. Original order was maintained.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: This series contains some restricted material. Restrictions related to specific material are listed in the detailed contents list. This series may require review before it is available for use. Please contact DCA for further details.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the University Chaplaincy, 2018, accession UA-2019-002.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains fliers and other material documenting Chaplaincy programming, including concerts, speakers, and participation in university and other events, as well as correspondence, fliers, and other materials documenting specific chaplains and chaplaincies. This series also contains publications, photographs, slides of Goddard Chapel, VHS tapes, and cassettes. VHS tapes document a memorial service for Allan Cormack; the 2002 University Baccalaureate Service; and the lecture "Sources of Hope for a Global Future" by Desmond Tutu. Cassette tapes document the Goddard Chapel Forum; the 1995 Interfaith Forum; the 1999 Book Forum; Dean David Maxwell in 1986;, and Jane Redmont in 1993.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This file contains slides of Goddard Chapel; VHS tapes of a memorial service for Allan Cormack, the 2002 University Baccalaureate Service, and the lecture "Sources of Hope for a Global Future" by Desmond Tutu; and cassette tapes of the Goddard Chapel Forum, the 1995 Interfaith Forum, the 1999 Book Forum, Dean David Maxwell in 1986, and Jane Redmont in 1993.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains video, audio, and photographic documentation of events held or attended by the Chaplaincy including the Goddard Chapel Forum, the Baccalaureate Service, and the Russell Lecture. This series also contains excel spreadsheets and word documents related to the Chaplaincy budget.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Records on digital media that are open for research have been stabilized and made available via Box. Note that files were not converted for access and all may not be viewable in Box. Please contact DCA for further details.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Video on the original media of this file did not work; only audio is available for this file.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: 20 years from the date of creation.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Excel spreadsheets and word documents relating to the Chaplaincy's budget from 2008-2010.

did.unittitle: Goddard Chapel Forum: Ambassador Grover Rees

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Transferred by the Tufts University Chaplaincy, 2020 -- 2021, accessions UA-2021-019, UA-2021-034, UA-2021-056, and UA-2022-029.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in received order.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This series was processed by Records and Accessioning Archivist Jane Kelly in 2021 and 2022. Digital materials were bagged using Bagger and ingested to the Tufts Digital Library. Physical materials were placed in archival boxes and folders where needed. Received order was maintained. A file-level inventory was created, and series and collection-level description were updated at the time of processing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains annual newsletters from the Buddhist, Catholic, Humanist, Muslim, and Protestant chaplaincies from 2015 through the 2020/2021 academic year, as well as event fliers, posters, and recordings; scrapbooks of newspaper clippings that relate to Chaplaincy activities; songbooks, hymnals, and organ music from Goddard Chapel; and other Goddard Chapel records.

A time to grieve, hope, and act: marking a year since Tufts' campus closure event program

"In the Wake of Obama's Hope: Thoughts on Black Lives Matter, Humanism, and Re-imagining Race Struggle" with Dr. Anthony B. Pinn event poster
"Chaplaincy for the 'Nones': Spiritual Care in an Increasingly Nonreligious America" event poster

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This group of records includes a chapel service book, song books, hymnals, and organ music used in Goddard Chapel, as well as "A Walking Tour of Goddard Chapel," a nine-page account of the history and traditions of the Chapel written by Edwin Rollins and accompanied by related background material. There are also Goddard Chapel masonry and roof repair specifications; slides; a book of Tufts University trivia; annual goals for University Chaplain Scotty McLennan, including related correspondence and memos; a Tufts Alumni pamphlet; and a monograph by William L. McLennan, Jr., Lecturer and Chaplain, Tufts University, "The Story of Business Ethics: Legend and Corporate Ethical Climate."
